New Records: Virat Kohli scored his 48th ODI hundred, now one short of Sachin Tendulkar’s world record of 49 ODI hundreds.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored 103 not out off 97 balls, helping India chase down Bangladesh's total with 261-3 in 41.3 overs.
Lokesh Rahul finished 34 not out, supporting Kohli in the chase.
Tanzid Hasan scored his maiden ODI half-century for Bangladesh.
Hardik Pandya hobbled off with a twisted left ankle and did not return to bowl or field.
Kuldeep Yadav provided a crucial breakthrough by trapping Tanzid Hasan lbw.
Ravindra Jadeja dismissed Litton Das and Najmul Hossain Shanto, contributing significantly to India's bowling effort.
Mahmudullah top-scored for Bangladesh with 46 off 36 balls.
Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill added 88 off 76 balls for the first wicket in India's chase.
Shubman Gill scored his maiden World Cup half-century with 53 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: India's Shubman Gill and Ravindra Jadeja attended a training session ahead of the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed his desire to make a big contribution and stay till the end.
Indian skipper Rohit Sharma mentioned that Hardik Pandya's injury is not major and they will plan accordingly.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The MCA Stadium in Pune was at full capacity with 33,610 fans.
India stays second in the points table with eight points from four games, trailing New Zealand on net run-rate.
Bangladesh stays seventh with just two points from one win in four games.
